metadata.title: CVE-2022-1195 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in the Linux kernel indrivers/net/hamradio. This flaw allows a local attacker with a userprivilege to cause a denial of service (DOS) when the mkiss or sixpackdevice is detached and reclaim resources early.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1195` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-4.15.0-191-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-4.15.0-191-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-generic - 4.15.0-191.202
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-191-lowlatency - 4.15.0-191.202
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-122-generic - 5.4.0-122.138~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-122-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-122.138~18.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-122-lowlatency - 5.4.0-122.138~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-191.202').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
